Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is slightly ribbed, the outer surface of the exterior has flaked away in part, what remains is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394394) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394394)
